repnme.cdata!:
Cameroon - Agricultural Extension and
            Training Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project was satisfactory. Key
            lessons learned under the project include: The impact of the
            public extension service can be increased by focusing on
            proper management, and regularly training and supervising
            staff at all levels. There is an urgent need to address
            institutional reform in Cameroon's agricultural sector.
            This includes clarifying the roles and functions of the
            various ministries involved, revamping administrative
            procedures including procedures for financial and human
            resource management, restructuring the organization of the
            ministries towards a stronger decentralization and reduction
            of headquarters staff, sub-contracting service delivery
            where possible, and increasing involvement of beneficiaries
            and stakeholders in the planning and priority setting
            processes. The quality of the technical messages improves
            when front-line extension staff and subject matter
            specialists are better equipped and trained to listen to
            farmers and to carry out farming system analysis. Extension
            should incorporate traditional mass media and modern
            information technology, strengthen community participation
            and oversight, improve monitoring and evaluation, and
            further strengthen research/extension linkages. The impact
            of the demonstration plots on the use of inputs has
            relatively little impact on farmers' investments for
            non-cash crop-related inputs; this is mainly due to lack of
            credit availability. Issues more relevant to female farmers
            and more female staff need to be added.

Cameroon - Agricultural Extension and

repnme.cdata!:
Cameroon - National Agricultural Extension
            and Training Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This project is integral to the
            Government's structural adjustment program, food
            security strategy, enhanced export performance, foreign
            exchange earnings and employment generation.  The priority
            objective is to increase farmer productivity by
            strengthening operational institutions, establishing systems
            for managing the extension services and by providing
            training to facilitate improved delivery of the services.
            Special attention will also be given to meeting the needs of
            women farmers.  The project will finance incremental
            extension activities in six of the ten provinces and will
            comprise four main components : a) reorganization and
            strengthening of extension structures; b) training; c)
            adaptive research; and d) seed multiplication.

Cameroon - National Agricultural Extension
